title: Malay Archipelago
summary: The Malay Archipelago (Cebuano: Kapupud-ang Malay, Malay: Kepulauan Melayu, Tagalog: Kapuluang Malay, Javanese: Nusantara)  is the archipelago between mainland Indochina and Australia. It has also been called the "Malay world," "Nusantara", "East Indies", Indo-Australian Archipelago, Spices Archipelago and other names over time. The name was taken from the 19th-century European concept of a Malay race, later based on the distribution of Austronesian languages.[3]
